  • Field Details

    • totalCustomers

      public final int totalCustomers

    • world

  • Constructor Details

    • CustomerManager

      public CustomerManager(float customerScale, UIOverlay overlay, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.World world, int customers)
      Parameters:
      customerScale - how big are customers as a multiplier of the unit scale.
      overlay - UIOverlay
      world - World
      customers - how many customers will spawn total. For endless mode, set this to 0.

    • CustomerManager

      public CustomerManager(SavedCustomerManager save, float customerScale, UIOverlay overlay, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.World world, FoodTextureManager textureManager)

    • CustomerManager

      public CustomerManager(float customerScale, UIOverlay overlay, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.World world, int customers, long seed)
      Initialise CustomerManager with an empty state and set random seed. This is useful for testing.
      Parameters:
      overlay - UIOverlay (probably mocked)
      customers - The total number of customers to spawn - 0 means endless
      seed - seed for the Random instance to generate set orders

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init(FoodTextureManager textureManager, com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage stage, Map<Integer,Box2dLocation> objectives, List<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2> spawnLocations)
      Add customers to stage and reset + initialise the state of CustomerManager.
      Parameters:
      textureManager - The manager of food textures that can be passed to the recipes
      stage - The stage to display customers on.
      objectives - The objectives loaded from the map
      spawnLocations - Spawn locations loaded from the map

    • load

      public void load(com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage stage, Map<Integer,Box2dLocation> objectives, List<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2> spawnLocations)
      A version of init(FoodTextureManager, Stage, Map, List) with fewer arguments and logic. This is because a lot of the state is loaded from the save.
      When loaded from a SavedCustomerManager, use this instead of .init()
      Parameters:
      stage - The stage to display customers on.
      objectives - The objectives loaded from the map
      spawnLocations - Spawn locations loaded from the map

    • getOrders

      public List<Recipe> getOrders()
      Returns:
      a List containing all orders represented as a Recipe, in the order they have been added.

    • act

      public void act(float delta)
      Needs to be called every frame to occasionally spawn customers.
      Parameters:
      delta - time since last frame in seconds

    • loseReputation

      protected void loseReputation()
      Lose a reputation point. Is supposed to be called by a customer.

    • nextRecipe

      public void nextRecipe(Customer customer)
      Complete the provided customers order and move on to the next one. Then update the UI. If all the recipes are completed, then show the winning UI.

      With the current implementation, it is possible to have endless mode use the totalCustomers value of 0 without requiring changes.

      Parameters:
      customer - The customer whose order is to be fulfilled.

    • addStation

      public void addStation(SubmitStation station)

    • generateCustomer

      public void generateCustomer()
      Create a new customer with an order.

    • walkBack

      public void walkBack(Customer customer)
      Calls makeItGoThere but with objective set to -1, effectively making the agent walk back to the despawn point.

      public Box2dLocation getObjective(int id)
